result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees and DNA surcharges by 2-10-17 or, if not paid, serve 25  days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Cordarius Mattox Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay as ordered.
25 days HOC, consecutive.
DUE & OWING.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 10 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs, fees  and  DNA surcharges by 2-10-17 or, if not paid, serve 25  days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in court with attorney Angel Lee Johnson.  Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad

Attorney Michael Jude previously in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-21-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Dennis Cordarius Mattox in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
